Why Yet Another Live Streaming App?

I needed a configurable, open source live video streaming application for my Android phone that will enable me to stream live audio and video data to several different sources online. In particular, the Smashing Pumpkins are coming to town and I want a reasonable way to remember the concert and replay it after the adrenaline rush of the rock concert and screwdrivers wears off. Being a code hacker by nature I decided to roll my own solution to this problem. There are already many social-media-based apps that allow you to do this, but the storage and postprocessing (i.e., saving your audio / video to external devices) of the streamed media options can be restrictive and limiting. There is already another (in)famous live streaming app for Android which allows users to stream live media directly to a BitTorent stream, though the last I checked off this app it had been swiftly removed from the Play Store for obviously being too convenient and piss-off-the-MPAA-like for users to get officially sanctioned access to. I\'m too weary of installing APKs from undocumented sources these days, so this is the best option for my needs of an app like this. I am providing it and signed APK downloads on GitHub (as well as on Play Store) as open source software that users can simply employ in their homebrew streaming operations (see disclaimer below) or hack and tweak to perfection for themselves.

Licensing and Free Versus Paid Versions:

This application and its Java / C++ source is provided free of charge to users and other entities for non-commercial usage only. Those users who would like to use this application for commercially motivated events and monitoring should contact the developer using the information below to work out an appropriate financial arrangement. At some point, depending on how many users of the non-commercial free app I get, some of the features of the app may be disabled in the -free flavor of the app on Play Store. I develop these apps in my free time. By all means if you like, or use, or particularly appreciate this application and its open source availability policy consider making a donation in the name of the developer\'s "good scotch fund" which incidentally tends to lead to productive work on apps like these getting written faster :) I can also be contracted to customize a specific revision of the app for closed-loop commercial purposes. Please just contact me and I can see what the timeline and developer fees would be for coding up your custom application.

Developer Contact and E-Mail:

You can email me about bug reports, commercial operations, feature requests and the like at maxieds@gmail.com. Please if you like and use this app drop me a line and let me know about it and what you use it for.

Disclaimers:

This application is made freely available to its users for legitimate purposes and strictly legal uses only. It is not an app for spying on others nor intended to imply that nefarious users can bypass the rights of others. Make sure that you have permission to record all streamed audio / video you run through this application and that any post-processed versions of this media do not violate any persons (or big bad company with a large team of landsharks or major associations) rights nor copyright. In short, a good rule of thumb (in life and in advice from man pages) is just not to be an a$$h*le.

All of that being said I will briefly justify why I think that my original presupposed usage and reasons for crafting this application are legitimate. Note first that this application does not allow users to directly post their streams to repositories like You Tube. In fact it only allows them to effectively archive their personal experiences and scenic whereabouts for later purposes. In my case, I legitimately paid for rights to view a concert. This implies a contract that I may participate in the experience time-shifted to a later point in time. Your milage may vary depending on how much of your favorite Pumpkins concert footage ends up actually getting posted to YouTube (See above life heuristic again).

ENJOY THE APP!

Sincerely, from the developers and friends who helped to test the app.
